page.title: 09MEDIA & INFORMATION SYSTEMS
page.content: Due to the scattered nature of the housing in the district,only those people who pay a fee to the Post Office get newspapers delivered. Bonchester P.O. and the Grocer's van also sell them.Many people have devised a rota system to deliver Sunday Newspapers.Most children get at least one comic or magazine. Most homes have at least one T.V.set, and very few have poor reception due to the hills,as new aerials now boost the strength of all four channels. A{MOBILE LIBRARY}visits the area every fortnight,and although stock is limited ,there is an efficient Request service.Schoolchildren may borrow Regional Library Books through { {HOBKIRK SCHOOL. }As{RADIO}reception is good,many tractors even have them fitted.Radio Tweed and Border T.V. are the most local broadcasting stations.
